intro: Astragalus lalesarensis, commonly known as the Lalesar milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus lalesarensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
